meanings.definition: To sleep longer than intended or necessary.
meanings.sent1: I overslept and missed my alarm this morning.
meanings.sent2: She always overslept on weekends and woke up late.
meanings.sent3: Tom overslept for his important meeting and had to rush in late.
meanings.sent4: The sun overslept its usual rising time, casting long shadows in the morning.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of oversleeping can be quite frustrating.

meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I overslept and missed my morning class.
meanings.sent2: He overslept on the day of the big presentation.
meanings.sent3: The cat overslept its usual nap time and was grumpy all evening.
meanings.sent4: The town overslept the arrival of the new circus, missing out on all the fun.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of having overslept can sometimes be amusing.
